fr.lipn.uima.util.align
Interface AlignerConsumer

All Known Implementing Classes:
TagAlignerFileWriterConsumer, TagPositionConsumer
public interface AlignerConsumer

An "aligner consumer" is a class that takes as input the output from the InputReader (which depends on the AnnotatedTextReader). His role consists in "doing something" with this output: it may write it to a file or store it in memory, for instance. The general principle is explained in AnnotatedTextReader.

Author:
moreau

Method Detail

initConsumer

void initConsumer()
                  throws AlignmentException
Called before starting aligning process. Initialize any resource here. This method is called before initializing the AnnotatedTextReader and the InputReader.

Throws:
AlignmentException

closeConsumer

void closeConsumer()
                   throws AlignmentException
Called after finishing aligning process. Dispose any resource here. This method is called after closing the AnnotatedTextReader and the InputReader.

Throws:
AlignmentException

requiresUnannotatedTokens

boolean requiresUnannotatedTokens()
Returns:
true if this consumer needs tokens with no annotation (i.e. all tokens).

requiresPosition

boolean requiresPosition()
Returns:
true if this consumer needs the position of tokens.

requiresSeparator

boolean requiresSeparator()
Returns:
true if this consumer needs the separator occuring before a token.

receiveTokenAndAnnotation

void receiveTokenAndAnnotation(java.lang.String annotatedToken,
                               java.lang.String inputToken,
                               java.lang.String annotation,
                               java.lang.String separator,
                               long startPos,
                               long endPos)
                               throws AlignmentException
Receives data to process from the InputReader and consumes it (e.g. writes to the output file). Some parameters may be unitialized/unused depending on the fact that this consumer requires it.

Parameters:
annotatedToken - The token to process (may be null or empty), as read in the annotated text
inputToken - The token to process (may be null or empty), as read in the reference input text
annotation - The annotation associated to this token (may be null or empty). It is up to the annotated text reader which metadata is taken into account: for instance it may be the left or right context of the token.
separator - A separator string if needed (may be null or empty). This AlignerConsumer is responsible for the way to use it.
startPos - Starting position of the token in the input text (if needed).
endPos - Ending position of the token in the input text (if needed).
Throws:
AlignmentException
